alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 6:02PM CDT until May 19 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR CLINTON AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 601 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Beaver Creek to 7 miles southeast of Nashville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Breese, Carlyle, Nashville, Centralia, Okawville, St. Rose, Germantown, Wamac, Beckemeyer, Irvington, Ashley, Boulder, Shattuc, Jamestown, Posen, Bartelso, Beaucoup, Hoyleton, Hoffman and Keyesport. This also includes Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 41 and 61. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Illinois. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
